words.def: the vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity

band or rope made of twisted twigs or stems

the cardinal number that is the sum of seven and one
Acidulated whey, sometimes mixed with buttermilk and sweet herbs, used as a cooling beverage.
A bondman; a slave.

a small branch or division of a branch (especially a terminal division)
Blame, responsibility, guilt.

Alternative spelling of ghee.

wetness caused by water

With a comparative or more and a verb phrase, establishes a parallel with one or more other such comparatives.

A letter capital Ð, small ð introduced into Old English to represent its dental fricative, then not distinguished from the letter thorn, no longer used in English but still in modern use in Icelandic, Faroese, and phonetics to represent the voiced dental fricative "th" sound as in the English word then.
A rope or chain for towing a boat.
(baseball) a successful stroke in an athletic contest (especially in baseball)
move fast

a return on a shot that seemed impossible to reach and would normally have resulted in a point for the opponent
a person who is deemed to be despicable or contemptible
two-year-old sheep
neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front

an expression of greeting

a light strong grey lustrous corrosion-resistant metallic element used in strong lightweight alloys (as for airplane parts)
the branch of engineering that deals with the use of computers and telecommunications to retrieve and store and transmit information
